title: Improve PWA install UX (prominent Install, no confusing Dismiss)

requirements.text: Update the PWA install prompt UI to make installation feel “one-tap” and remove confusing dismissal wording: in `frontend/src/components/PWAInstallCallout.tsx`, make the primary action a prominent "Install" button (or "Install Vibechat"), and remove the current "Dismiss" button text from the UI.

quotes: About installing can you make it easy to install.... Where dismiss is just put there install for all people to install it to there phones just like other phones easy

acceptanceCriteria: When the browser provides an install prompt (`beforeinstallprompt` captured), the callout shows a clear primary CTA labeled "Install" (or "Install Vibechat") that triggers the install prompt.
The UI no longer shows a button labeled "Dismiss" anywhere in the install callout.
If the user completes installation successfully, the callout disappears (no longer rendered).

requirements.text: Ensure users on browsers/devices that do not support programmatic install still have a clear, easy path: when `isInstallable` is false in `PWAInstallCallout`, show short English instructions explaining how to install via the browser menu (e.g., "Add to Home Screen" / "Install App") and that availability depends on the browser/device.

quotes: make it easy to install... for all people to install it to there phones

acceptanceCriteria: On environments where `beforeinstallprompt` is not available, the install UI displays concise manual-install instructions in English.
The copy explicitly clarifies that installation availability depends on the browser/device (to avoid implying install works identically for everyone).
The install UI does not imply that Vibechat can force-install on unsupported browsers.

requirements.text: Add a low-friction way to temporarily hide the install callout without using the word "Dismiss" (e.g., a small "Not now" text button or an X icon), and persist that choice locally so returning users are not repeatedly shown the callout after hiding it.

quotes: Where dismiss is just put there install

acceptanceCriteria: The callout can be hidden via a secondary control that is not labeled "Dismiss".
After hiding the callout, it stays hidden on page refresh/reload (local persistence).
If the user installs the PWA, the callout stays hidden regardless of the saved hide state.

constraints: Do not modify immutable frontend paths (e.g., `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/ui`).
Do not add any backend changes for this request.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Changing the existing PWA manifest, service worker caching strategy, or icon set (unless required for the install prompt UI to function).
Implementing native app store distribution (iOS App Store / Google Play).
